data.meta_description: "The leadership of Black Women has taught me that our potential knows no bounds; Black women can and will change the world, and I want to be a part of it."‚Ä¶
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

"The leadership of Black Women has taught me that our potential knows no bounds; Black women can and will change the world, and I want to be a part of it." -Evodie Alvarez, Grade 12, School for Advanced Studies North Campus The wait is over! We're excited to share the winners of our 3rd Annual Black History Month Essay Contest in honor of veteran, community leader, equality and civil rights activist, and black press magnate, Garth C. Reeves Sr. üìù As we recognize International Women‚Äôs Day today, we salute the efforts of our Scholars to research, reflect and write about Black Women in Florida whose leadership helped shape our state. ‚úèÔ∏è Congratulations to all our winners for their achievements and #breakthroughs! üí° Your insights, wisdom, and words help amplify the works of magnificent Black Women in our community. 2022 First Place Winners: High School - Evodie Alvarez - Esther Rolle ‚ÄúThe Symbol of Power: Black Women and Their Impact‚Äù Middle School - Nathan Samuel - "Felecia Hatcher Moves the World" Elementary School - Izaiah Afflick - Esther Rolle "When Black Women Lead, We All Win" We are grateful for the continued sponsorship of Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, which generously provided laptops to first, second, and third place winners in each category. To read our winning essays and learn more, visit: https://lnkd.in/dvmsrQxJ #WomensDay #womeninhistory #womenshistorymonth #womenshistory #herstory #women #womenempowerment #IWD2022 #SocialJustice #ChangingLives #CreatingLeaders #Breakthrough #Miami #HardWork #RawTalent #MiamiFL #SouthFlorida #DadeCounty #DadeSchools #Education #Educators #Scholars #TeachingFellows #Volunteers #MDCPS #ChangeMakers #Support #Community #Village #Learning #Learn #BreakthroughMiami #GarthReevesSr #GarthReeves #EssayContest
